website_summaries.verdict: This all-terrain bike can conquer everything from sand to snow thanks to its fat tire design.
pros: Oversized tires offer stability and traction
4.25-inch knobby tires can conquer any terrain: beach, woods, even snow
Cruiser design frame with plenty of clearance
Alloy 4-inch wide wheel set with disc brakes
cons: Brakes do not stop the bike immediately

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Bike is exactly as advertised. I can't get the breaks to adjust the way I want them to, so I will bring to local bike shop. I've rented trail bikes here in the Northwest and while this isn't a $1000 bike, it's as good as any of the $300 - $400 bikes for a lot less. We pretty much ride beach and mild trails, so the weight doesn't both us. Also, shipping was great, customer service has contacted me if I need any assistance. The only reason I'm taking it to local shop is because I need some misc gear and they know their stuff better than me.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Great Fat Tire Bike! Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for his 11th birthday! He loves it and people comment how cool it is! We did also have the problem with the backwards forks but no biggie. Good bike for the price! The fact it is black and orange was a bonus as orange is his favorite color.
customer_reviews.author: Halfhoney!

customer_reviews.title: Good bike. Head turner. Fun.
customer_reviews.text: Just add some quick connect for the front wheels. Overall perfect bike for the campground, beach to be a bike pimp
customer_reviews.author: Philly porterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Really nice fat tire bike
customer_reviews.text: Really nice fat tire bike. Bought this for our 10 year old and he loves it. The bike seems well built. The only complaint is the type of brakes, difficult to stop quickly at faster speeds. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Proateverything

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for actual trail riding
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun bike and great for the street or gravel road. Definitely not made to handle actual mountain bike trails.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gabbard

customer_reviews.title: Like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the bike. It's about $100 overpriced for the quality of the brake components. Everything else on it seems solid and true. But I'm happy with it and would buy it again. My Son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Powell Sanders

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller but still, all Fat Tire!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bargain if you are looking for a smaller platform to build a fat tire bike. I bought this for my wife and after a few upgrades, it's perfect. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for what it is. A mongoose fat bike. But very poorly designed. I get the "you get what you pay for". But I don't understand how a bigger chainring than should be on it (by far I might add) makes sense. Or 190mm hub spacing and 100mm rims on 3.8 tires. Final thing, the forks don't have lawyer tabs and the dropouts are backwards. Tabs aren't a big deal but reversed dropouts is puzzling. Made a couple changes to it for my son to lower the gearing and shed some weight. He likes it and much more usable now.
customer_reviews.author: RAKC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old sone loves this bike, I also ordered some mud fenders.
customer_reviews.author: Street007

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike, rides smooth and shifts smooth
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike, rides smooth and shifts smooth. Took a little trial and error to figure out which way the front spoke should go to attach the wheel. The directions are for more than one model of bike so it takes some time to find the right set of directions. The tires are huge, if your not use to it your feet or leg will brush up to the tire when making sharp turns. Since the tires are so big you might want to get a shorter bike than you might normally get, to accommodate for the fat tires.
customer_reviews.author: Tara L

customer_reviews.title: Fun bike
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it! The only thing is, it is heavy, but I guess that is why the price is low.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: It seems like a great bike bu5tr the box was smashed a ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a great bike bu5tr the box was smashed a little; so it's in the shop, being adjusted the speeds and brakes. As soon as I get it back I'll give it a rating
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Armento

customer_reviews.title: The bike is great!! I bought it for my wife and ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great!! I bought it for my wife and she loves it. You can use the bike on almost any type of terrain, beach, mountains or mud. It has a great paint scheme, easy shifting and is a comfortable rider.
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike for the price,my 11 yrs old grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm happy with the bike
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with the bike. The only real complaint I have is that you can't really adjust the handlebar height. The disc brakes don't exactly stop on a dime, but that might improve with some additional adjustment. Comes mostly assembled and while not terribly difficult to finish, you do have to ensure you get the wheels straight and true for the disc brakes to engage properly. I've only taken it around the block a couple of times, but shifter seemed to work well. Fat wheels do make more noise, but not enough to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Marcum

customer_reviews.title: Brakes need adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son (10) and he lives it.. The only issue I have is that the brakes don't stop immediately. I have adjusted the cables, pins, the pads, everything.. I have gone online to mongoose sure and read multiple blogs and still unable to correct the issue. I would worry more if this was going to be used more frequently off road and such.
customer_reviews.author: Corby Ince

customer_reviews.title: I bought this bike to be assembled and tuned up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike to be assembled and tuned up. They basically said is was a piece of S*** neither the front or rear brakes worked. The gearshifter didn't work, and they said for the size of the frame you would have to buy new breaks to make it work. They suggested donating it to Aftica
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike for the price. I agree with the others on rear derailer and brake adjustments. That is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

product_meta.title: Mongoose Kong Fat Tire Mountain Bike for Kids, 20-Inch Wheels
product_meta.description: The Mongoose Logan 24 fat tire bike is designed to be ridden easily on a wide variety of terrain thanks to oversized tires for stability and traction. Fat tire cruiser frame geometry adds a comfortable but athletic riding position. The Logan is equipped with a supersized Beach frame with plenty of clearance to conquer any terrain with the 4 1/4 knobby tires. Alloy 4 wide wheel set with drilled rims and disc brakes for easy stopping, low rise handlebars for comfort and stability and 3 piece cranks, the 7 speed gearing rear derailleur make this the perfect bike to go conquer anything.
feature_bullets: Mongoose Supersized beach cruiser 4 1/4" knobby tires
Cruiser design frame with plenty of clearance to conquer any terrain
Alloy 4" wide wheel set with disc brakes
